title: How many games do you actually need to win to get from unranked to gold?

embed.description: Check your Summoner statistics, MMR, realtime spectate and using powerful global LoL Charts!

body: I just finished my first 10 ranked games with only 8 wins, but i still get to gold 5, can someone explain to me ? I thought i have to win 10 out of 10.

replies.body:
In my first ever provisionals I won 4 and got B3. in the next season i won 3 and got b3, in this seasons provisionals i ended season 4 as B1, i won 5 provisionals and got b4.... logic!

so in other words i don't think there is an exact science to it.

If you win 16 in a row you will almost definitely be gold.

It's possible to get gold from your 10 original placements. Pretty unlikely though afaik.
I got gold winning only 8 games
it depends on what you placed last season yes its possible riot just changed so if you in 10/10 and you were bronze 1 you can't jump to plat

Many variables:

* Did you duo with someone? Duoing artificially inflates MMR so if you were consistently able to perform at this level then it would indicate your natural MMR is somewhere at the level (unranked MMR starts at a sliver 4/5 level and adjusts from there, with the biggest LP gain and loss happening in the first three games. Duo MMR would be high silver and would probably reach low gold as you continue winning). 

* What was the order of your wins/losses? Apparently the biggest gains/losses in MMR are made in the first 3ish games to try and match you to more suitable opponents instead of making you suffer versing lower/higher skill opponents than you should be matching.
